thread.title: Ukip WILL win by-election in 'Brexit capital' and continue political earthquake – Farage
thread.title_full: Ukip WILL win by-election in 'Brexit capital' and continue political earthquake – Farage

title: Ukip WILL win by-election in 'Brexit capital' and continue political earthquake – Farage
text: Ukip WILL win by-election in 'Brexit capital' and continue political earthquake – Farage Ukip WILL win by-election in 'Brexit capital' and continue political earthquake – Farage NIGEL FARAGE has roared Paul Nuttall will win the Stoke-on-Trent Central by-election next month. PUBLISHED: 09:25, Mon, Jan 30, 2017 | UPDATED: 09:35, Mon, Jan 30, 2017 The MEP for South East England said he was convinced current Ukip leader Mr Nuttall will be victorious in kick-starting the next stage in the party’s history. Speaking on Sunday Politics , Mr Farage said: “I’ve always been told, never make predictions. But I like making predictions, I think Paul will win Stoke.” Put to him that the constituency was one of Ukip’s best chances in the country and that it is referred to as “the capital of Brexit ”, Mr Farage said the win would send a powerful message. PA•BBC Nigel Farage is confident over Paul Nuttall by-election result I like making predictions, I think Paul will win Stoke Nigel Farage He said: “If he doesn’t it will be tough, if he doesn’t we’ll still have our four million loyalists. "If he does, then we can actually see that Labour are beatable in their heartlands and I think Ukip will be off to the second very big stage of its history.” Labour’s candidate for the Stoke central by-election previously claimed on Twitter that Brexit was a “massive pile of s**t” . GETTY Paul Nuttall confident of political earthquake Councillor Gareth Snell tweeted the comments ahead of the election, which was triggered by former Labour MP Tristram Hunt’s decision to step down and take a job at the Victoria and Albert Museum. Nigel Farage has criticised a group of Labour MPs who put forward a Commons option to scrap the Government’s bill to trigger Brexit, labelling them “enemies of democracy”. Related articles
